title: Ticket #7090: Python3 bindings for OS X
description:
There is a desire to enhance a LIGO package (GWCelery) that manages Condor jobs to use Python bindings. The primary platform for GWCelery is currently SL7.

GWCelery is developed and tested under OS X, so Python 3 bindings for that platform would be helpful as well.
remarks:
2019-Jun-04 11:31:37 by anderson:
Leo Singer as the primary developer for GWCelery has clarified, "What we need are relocatable binary wheels for macOS".

2019-Jul-31 13:25:57 by tannenba:
Python 3 support in the RPM and DEB packaging was completed in HTCondor v8.8.4 for RHEL 7.

Still have MacOS to do....

2020-Oct-27 14:43:55 by jfrey:
Note that the current code provides Python 3 bindings for macOS, but not relocatable binary wheels.
check_ins:

2020-Oct-13 23:44   Check-in [61491]: Remove nmi glue hacks for macOS. #7090 Primarily, this allows the python3 bindings to be built against the libraries from python.org (controlled by the configuration on the machines). (By Jaime Frey )
